title: Graph of Function - Rate of Change Behavior

content.description:
The x axis ranges from 0 to 13 in increments of 1. The y axis ranges from negative 200 to 450 in increments of 50. All coordinates are approximate.

Moving from left to right:

The curve begins at (0 comma 420). This point is labeled A.

The curve decreases at a lesser and lesser rate to reach a relative minimum at (3.8 comma negative 180). This point is labeled B.

The curve increases at a greater and greater rate to reach point C at (7 comma 20).

The curve continues to increase, but at a lesser and lesser rate, to reach point D at (10.2 comma 210). This is a relative maximum.

The curve decreases at a greater and greater rate until reaching the point E at (13 comma negative 100), at which point the curve ends.

The figure shows the graph of function <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> for <math alttext="0 less or equal than x less or equal than 13"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>13</mn></math>. The endpoints of the interval are labeled with points <math alttext="A"><mi>A</mi></math> and <math alttext="E"><mi>E</mi></math>. Two other extrema for <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> are labeled with points <math alttext="B"><mi>B</mi></math> and <math alttext="D"><mi>D</mi></math>. Point <math alttext="C"><mi>C</mi></math> is the only point of inflection of the graph of <math alttext="g"><mi>g</mi></math> for <math alttext="0 less or equal than x less or equal than 13"> <mn>0</mn> <mo>≤</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>≤</mo> <mn>13</mn> </math>. Let <math alttext="t subscript A"><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>A</mi></msub></math>, <math alttext="t subscript B"><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>B</mi></msub></math>, <math alttext="t subscript C"><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>C</mi></msub></math>, <math alttext="t subscript D"><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>D</mi></msub></math>, and <math alttext="t subscript E"><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>E</mi></msub></math> represent the <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>-coordinates at those points.
content.question: Of the following, on which intervals is the rate of change of <math alttext="g"> <mi>g</mi> </math> decreasing?

choices.label: <math alttext="open square brackets t subscript A comma t subscript B close square brackets"><mfenced close="]" open="["><mrow><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>A</mi></msub><mo>,</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>B</mi></msub></mrow></mfenced></math> only

<math alttext="open square brackets t subscript D comma t subscript E close square brackets"><mfenced close="]" open="["><mrow><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>D</mi></msub><mo>,</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>E</mi></msub></mrow></mfenced></math> only

<math alttext="open square brackets t subscript A comma t subscript B close square brackets"><mfenced close="]" open="["><mrow><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>A</mi></msub><mo>,</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>B</mi></msub></mrow></mfenced></math> and <math alttext="open square brackets t subscript D comma t subscript E close square brackets"><mfenced close="]" open="["><mrow><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>D</mi></msub><mo>,</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>E</mi></msub></mrow></mfenced></math>

<math alttext="open square brackets t subscript C comma t subscript D close square brackets"><mfenced close="]" open="["><mrow><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>C</mi></msub><mo>,</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>D</mi></msub></mrow></mfenced></math> and <math alttext="open square brackets t subscript D comma t subscript E close square brackets"><mfenced close="]" open="["><mrow><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>D</mi></msub><mo>,</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>E</mi></msub></mrow></mfenced></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open square brackets t subscript C comma t subscript D close square brackets"><mfenced close="]" open="["><mrow><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>C</mi></msub><mo>,</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>D</mi></msub></mrow></mfenced></math> and <math alttext="open square brackets t subscript D comma t subscript E close square brackets"><mfenced close="]" open="["><mrow><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>D</mi></msub><mo>,</mo><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>E</mi></msub></mrow></mfenced></math>

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations to answer a question or construct a model, with and without technology.
